title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
Hi,

This one had liquid exposure towards the centre of the board. At least that's all I can see here

Issues:

Slow performance
Fan High Speed constantly
No sound via speakers nor headphones
Backlight goes on and off

I put it thru Crest cleaner as it was quite dirty

After crest sounds seems to be back (some audible regular 'burp' from the speakers) but other issues remain
Cant see anything wrong under the scope 

Some readings below:

Q7706

1 8.59v 7.92v switching from one to another
2 8.6v 7.92 same as pin 1
3 8.35v 6.4v jumping
4 8.6v
5 from 0v to 6.2v (variation of values)
6 looks like I am "draining it" will go from 2.3v to 0v every time I put the probes on

D7701

1 8v goes down, then raises up
2 16v and "draining down"

F7700

1 8.6v
2 8.6v

There is a continuity between D7701 and A5 ball of U7701


Please assist

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
"Fan High Speed constantly"
Usually trackpad board/flex.
Sometime caused by LIO board/flex.
Their connectors can get problems by corrosion too.

As per schematic, p?ns 1, 2, 5, 6 for Q7706 are tied together.
Check if pins 2 & 5 of Q7707 are steady high.

Do you get steady 3V3 at pins 18/19 of J8300?
Also check pin 14 level.
Image always present, only backlight flickers?

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message: These issues all sound like they are related to the IO board and cable. Have you tried new ones?

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
[B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/1153-johnb8812"]JohnB8812[/URL] [/B]Looks like you were right.
Found some replacement io board and cable, just the high fan speed now :D
I will remember to always check with another IO board!

Thank you [B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL] [/B]I will see if I can sort this fan issue now

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
All sorted now.

Thank you very much for your help!

Unfortunately the unit is back, high fan and slow performance only this time.
[B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL] [/B]I will test the keyboard flex cable, apart of that, any other things I should check?

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
I suppose corrosion still affects the board.
Possibly some crap accumulated under SMC/CPU.
You can try heating them untill 180-200 degrees; use only quality flux.
But inspect first for any liquid sign on the board.

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
Ok,
before doing anything else I tried a software solution.
Macs Fan Control seems to be working great. I tied the fan to the cpu core temps.
Any way to make the change permanent or this solution is better?
BTW all temps displayed in the app are below 35 so not sure why the fan kicks in at all :/

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message: Run HWMonitor, it shows more information...

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
thank you

OK, cpu heatpipe, cpu proximity, pch die, memory proximity and airflow report 128 degrees Celcius. I am guessing one or more sensores are broken, yes?

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:
Start digging around U5800, page 44.
Check all related sensors, traces, resistors...

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message:

In your experience, would it matter if I left it like that?

title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
message: If system run smoothly, then no problem...
